citation.article-title: Polyphasic taxonomic approach in the description of Alishewanella fetalis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a human foetus.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Alishewanella (A.li.she.wa.nel'la. L. pronoun. alius the other; M.L. fem. n. Alishewanella the other Shewanella)
Facultatively anaerobic and uses TMAO, nitrate, thiosulphate and nitrite, but not sulphite or ferric iron, as electron acceptors.
Halotolerant and requires NaCl for growth.
Glucose is not catabolized with production of acid.
Hydrolyses gelatin and aesculin but is unable to produce indole, urease, β-galactosidase, arginine dihydrolase and H2S.
Does not grow at temperatures of 20 °C or less.
The DNA G+­C content is 51 mol%.
The type species is Alishewanella fetalis.
